subject: Re: [junit] Thankfully I found this group
msgSnippet: ... In IDEA, just add your tests to the coonfigurations pulldown in the middle of the tool bar. ... Then you will want to use HttpUnit or something similar in
messageBody:
On Mon, 20 Dec 2004 21:24:57 -0000, scottchamilton <scott@...> wrote:
>
>
> I have a question, however basic, for those in the know. I recently
> began working in a JAVA based environment which will begin to
> utilize JUnit for testing. I will be using IntelliJ IDEA to write
> my code.
>
> I cannot find basic instructions anywhere in regard to kicking off
> JUnit and utilizing it's graphic interface to enter my suite
> information and run my tests.

In IDEA, just add your tests to the coonfigurations pulldown in the
middle of the tool bar.

>
> The first set of tests will be to verify items on a web page and do
> simple navigation.

Then you will want to use HttpUnit or something similar in addition to JUnit
